intro: Haloragis uniflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved starflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haloragaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salty and windy conditions. Haloragis uniflora is an important component of coastal vegetation, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for native wildlife.
